item.title: M4 carbine
item.dc:creator: wordpress4
item.description: The M4 carbine (officially Carbine, Caliber 5.56 mm, M4) is a 5.56×45mm NATO, gas-operated, magazine-fed carbine developed in the United States during the 1980s. It is a shortened version of the M16A2 assault rifle.
item.content:encoded:
The M4 carbine (officially Carbine, Caliber 5.56 mm, M4) is a 5.56×45mm NATO, gas-operated, magazine-fed carbine developed in the United States during the 1980s. It is a shortened version of the M16A2 assault rifle.

The M4 is extensively used by the United States Armed Forces, with decisions to largely replace the M16 rifle in United States Army (starting 2010) and United States Marine Corps (USMC) (starting 2016) combat units as the primary infantry weapon and service rifle. The M4 has been adopted by over 60 countries worldwide, and has been described as “one of the defining firearms of the 21st century”.

Since its adoption in 1994,[10] the M4 has undergone over 90 modifications to improve the weapon’s ergonomics and modularity, including: the M4A1, which strengthened the barrel and replaced the burst-fire option with fully automatic option; the SOPMOD, an accessory kit containing optical attachments; and the underbarrel M203 grenade launcher.

In April 2022, the U.S. Army selected the SIG MCX Spear, designated XM7, as the winner of the Next Generation Squad Weapon Program to replace the M16/M4.

item.title: AK-74
item.dc:creator: wordpress4
item.description: Airsoft copy of the AK-74M machine gun from the Chinese manufacturer E & L Airsoft. Drives AK series from E & L are distinguished by high quality of assembly and reliability of operation. According to the manufacturer's statement, part of the parts for the drive housing are taken from the submachine gun and adapted for use in AEG, other elements of the housing are manufactured according to technologies and standards similar to the production of firearms.
item.content:encoded:
Airsoft copy of the AK-74M machine gun from the Chinese manufacturer E & L Airsoft.
Drives AK series from E & L are distinguished by high quality of assembly and reliability of operation. According to the manufacturer’s statement, part of the parts for the drive housing are taken from the submachine gun and adapted for use in AEG, other elements of the housing are manufactured according to technologies and standards similar to the production of firearms.
This Electropneumatic AK-74M replica from E & L is a premium model of an airsoft AK. The high-quality assembly of the drive can hardly be evaluated other than “excellent” – all parts are scrupulously adjusted to each other, and there are no backlashes as a class. The use of strong steel of excellent quality has a good effect on the strength and impact resistance of the drive. The appearance of the machine, and the feeling when you hold it in your hands, make you doubt whether it is really a toy.
